title: Drawing, "Study for an Oval Ceiling Design: "Apollo, Strength, and Love"", 1760–89
medium: Pen and brush and black ink, gray wash, black chalk on off-white laid paper
markings:
CM stamps in brown lower center.
Brandigee stamp. LL
inscribed:
Inscribed in pen and brown ink, lower right:  Dr. 12
Lower left, in graphite, partially obliterated inscription: Fidele Fischetti
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Apollo raises a torch. Strength supports a column and holds her left hand with a sword over a fire. Love has a fire on her forehead and is accompanied by a dog and putti carrying burning hearts. The figures are seated on clouds. More putti are in attendance.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Study for an Oval Ceiling Design: "Apollo, Strength, and Love"", 1760–89.
1760–89. Pen and brush and black ink, gray wash, black chalk on off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-6455.
